articles.title: Kim Jong Un Meets Ex-NBA Star and His Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Meets Ex-NBA Star and His Party
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un met ex-NBA star Dennis Rodman and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
					 He warmly greeted them and had a cordial talk with them.
					
					 Warmly welcoming Dennis Rodman visiting the DPRK again as a friend in a good season, Kim Jong Un told him that he might visit the DPRK any time and spend pleasant days, having a rest.
					
					 Saying he feels very grateful to Kim Jong Un for sparing a precious time to meet him and his party despite his tight schedule, Dennis Rodman said this is an expression of good faith towards the Americans.
					
					 He said that he was fortunate to revisit the DPRK as he has friendly relations with broad-minded Marshal Kim Jong Un. Dennis Rodman evinced his will to contribute to boosting diverse sports and cultural exchange with the DPRK.
					
					 He presented Kim Jong Un and his wife Ri Sol Ju with a gift he prepared with the deepest respect for them.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, together with him and his party, watched a basketball match between the April 25 Team and the Amnokgang Team.
					
					 Kim Jong Un hosted a dinner for Dennis Rodman and his party.
					
					 Expressing his heartfelt thanks to Kim Jong Un for spending a lot of time for him and his party and according them the warmest hospitality, Dennis Rodman said he would remember this visit as an unforgettable beautiful memory all his life.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The puppet south Korean regime is harshly suppressing a lawmaker from the Unified Progressive Party and others concerned on absurd charges of plotting rebellion.
					 The puppet Intelligence Service (IS) and other fascist riff-raffs searched the houses and offices of those concerned of the Unified Progressive Party and put them into custody. And no sooner had a coterie of the "Saenuri Party" cooked up a motion calling for the arrest of a lawmaker from an opposition party at the puppet National Assembly than the IS committed such harsh atrocity of throwing him into prison.
					
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in an information bulletin No. 1040 Friday said it is the first time since the end of the military dictatorship that the serving National Assemblyman was arrested and taken into custody by the regime.
					
					 What arouses bigger anger is that the puppet south Korean regime is stirring up confrontation with its fellow countrymen in the north, groundlessly pulling up the DPRK over the case, the information bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 The Justice Minister and other die-hard confrontational maniacs of the "Saenuri Party" are now working hard to deliberately link the case with the DPRK, while talking about the "formation of an underground revolutionary organization guided by the Juche idea" and the "forces seeking to overthrow the social system through cooperation with the north". The IS and the prosecution are also loudly crying out for directing the focus of investigation into proving the relations between the DPRK and the Unified Progressive Party and the conservative media are kicking up the smear campaign, talking about "the north's ambition for reunification through communization" and "camouflaged programme of the north's Workers' Party".
					
					 The puppet conservative forces' attempt to deliberately link this case with the north is an intolerable mockery of its efforts for dialogue and peace and will to repair the inter-Korean relations and an unpardonable provocation to them. 
					
					 What is going on in south Korea clearly indicates that it is none other than the puppet regime and the U.S. that are to chiefly blame for unstable situation and escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The fascist confrontation maniacs are sadly mistaken if they think they can stifle the pro-reunification patriotic forces and progressive democratic forces of south Korea and put brake on the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and stem the trend of the situation in the vicinity with such despicable plot. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop such foolish racket as pricking their own eyes. Should they persist in their repressive campaign which will seriously affect the inter-Korean relations, they will be wholly responsible for it.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- First Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad Thursday.
					 The president in the message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the friendly people of the DPRK in the name of the Syrian Arab people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. He also wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK bigger progress and prosperity.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, the president in the message reconfirmed Syria's efforts to strengthen the friendly and cooperative relations between Syria and the DPRK in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception for World Judo Champion
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception for World Judo Champion
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Cabinet of the DPRK hosted a reception at Okryu Restaurant on Friday for woman judoka Sol Kyong who proved successful at the 2013 World Judo Championships.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, players and coaches.
					
					  Kim Yong Jin said in a congratulatory speech made at the reception that sportspersons of the DPRK achieved steady big successes, adding that this is ascribable to the love and trust of supreme leader Kim Jong Un who has bestowed the highest honor and happiness upon the sportspersons who exalted the honor of the country.
					
					 He urged all players and coaches to achieve shining successes at international games by embodying playing principles, methods and tactical system of Korean style and dynamically raising the hot wind of training of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Player Sol Kyong in her reply speech extended deepest thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un who showed such deep loving care for her though she did what she should do.
					
					 She firmly pledged to make steady successes at international games by further improving her physical and technical ability and thus repay the benevolence of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: World Judo Champion Welcomed
articles.content:
World Judo Champion Welcomed 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Sol Kyong who bagged a gold medal at the 2013 World Judo Championships in Brazil returned home on Friday. 
					 She was warmly greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea; Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet; and officials concerned.
					
					 Pyongyangites put garlands around the necks of Sol Kyong and her coach, warmly congratulating them on their success.
					
					 They warmly congratulated her, waving hands towards her in streets and from balconies of apartment houses. 
					
					 She placed a bouquet before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK Health Delegation Leaves for India
articles.content:
DPRK Health Delegation Leaves for India 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of public health of the DPRK led by Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk left here Friday to take part in the 31st meeting of health ministers of Southeast region and the 66th general meeting of the World Health Organization to be held in New Delhi.

articles.title: Delegations of Overseas Compatriots Arrive
articles.content:
Delegations of Overseas Compatriots Arrive
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China led by Chairwoman Choe Un Bok, the delegation of officials of the Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China led by Choe Su Bong, vice-chairperson of the general association, and the delegation of the Federation of Korean Economic Workers in China led by Chairman Ri Sun Nam arrived here Friday to take part in the celebrations of the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The delegation of officials of Korean commercial associations in Japan led by Kim Myong Su, vice managing director of the Federation of Korean Men of Commerce in Japan arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Here 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions led by Vice-President Yang Yong Xeng Tong Ye arrived here on Friday. 
					 Also arriving here on the same day was the delegation of the Bangladeshi Group for the Study of the Songun Policy headed by Chairman M. Jahangir Khan. 
					
					 Earlier arrivals included the delegation of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia led by Vice-Chairman Gennady Kulikov, the delegation of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea led by General Secretary Sheikh Rafiqul Islam Bablu, the delegation of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan led by Secretary General Javed Ahmed Ansari and the delegation of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development led by Member of its Leadership Council N. Sarantuya.

articles.title: Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 They were handed to an official concerned by Hassan Reza Husseini, military attache of the Iranian embassy here who is doyen of the corps, on Friday.

articles.title: Staff Members of Missions of Int'l Organizations Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Staff Members of Missions of Int'l Organizations Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the missions of the United Nations Development Programme and the United Nations Children's Fund here laid floral baskets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them on Friday on the occasion of the 65th founding anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Brazilian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Brazilian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Roberto Colin, Brazilian ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Friday on the occasion of the 191st anniversary of its independence. 
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice Department Director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Pak Kun Gwang, Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade O Ryong Chol, Vice-Chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries So Ho Won who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Brazil Friendship and Culture Association, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					 Staff members of the Brazilian embassy were present at the reception. 
					
					 Roberto Colin warmly congratulated the Korean people on the 65th founding anniversary of the DPRK, noting that it is the stand of Brazil to boost the cooperative relations with it. 
					
					 Extending support to the recent efforts of the DPRK government to peacefully settle regional issues, he expressed the will to contribute to achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would achieve bigger successes under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said in his speech that the DPRK is pleased that the Brazilian government and people are achieving the economic stability and development of the country. 
					
					 He noted that the peoples of the two countries formed friendly ties and have supported and cooperated with each other in line with the common aspiration and desire for independence, peace, development and prosperity. 
					
					 The DPRK government will as ever set store by friendship with Brazil and boost the bilateral relations in various fields, he added.

articles.title: Performance Given Schoolchildren's Art Groups
articles.content:
Performance Given Schoolchildren's Art Groups
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by members of the schoolchildren's art groups in Pyongyang at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre on Friday to mark the 65th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including vocal sextet "Whole Life of Generalissimo Was Dedicated to My Country", small chorus "The Fluttering National Flag of the Republic", piano and song " Our Beautiful Country" and a series of revolutionary songs.
					
					 The performers highly praised the immortal exploits the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung performed by founding the DPRK, establishing the socialist system centered on the popular masses and thereby providing the Korean people with  an eternal cradle of happiness.
					
					 In such numbers as oungum ensemble "We Miss You Very Much" and girls' chorus "The General and Children" the performers impressively expressed ardent yearning for the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il who made ceaseless long journeys for Songun leadership for the country and its people and rosy future of the younger generation.
					
					 Also staged were numbers dealing with the bright and cheerful appearance of the schoolchildren of the country happily growing up to be pillars in the era of Songun, knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy, under the deep loving care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Exhibition and Scientific and Technological Public Presentation Held
articles.content:
Exhibition and Scientific and Technological Public Presentation Held 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- An exhibition and scientific and technological public presentation in the field of fuel for inhabitants took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House from Wednesday to Friday. 
					 On display in the venue were diagrams and products showcasing more than 530 achievements made by officials and workers in the fields of fuel supply, science and education, and scientists and technicians in Pyongyang and various  provincial capitals, cities and counties. 
					
					 The events were divided into the combustion additives, fuel, combustion appliances and fuel production processes panels. 
					
					 There was also presentation of experience in the period.

articles.title: Women's Premier Soccer Semi-Finals Held
articles.content:
Women's Premier Soccer Semi-Finals Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The semi-finals of women's premier soccer teams took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium Friday to mark the 65th birthday of the DPRK. 
					 Semi-finals were played between April 25 Team and Rimyongsu Team which came first in Group A and Group C respectively and between Sobaeksu Team and Myohyangsan Team which placed first in Group B and Group D respectively.
					
					 April 25 Team and Sobaeksu Team beat their rivals 2:1 respectively to advance into finals.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Father of Socialist Korea
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Father of Socialist Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung is the founder of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the father of socialist Korea.
					 On September 9, Juche 37 (1948), he declared the birth of the DPRK, thus realizing the centuries-old desire of the Koreans for a genuine government.
					
					 Since then, the Korean people have played a role of master of the state and society and the DPRK has imposingly exercised its sovereign right in the international arena.
					
					 Kim Il Sung in his early years set out on the road of revolution, firmly resolved not to return home before Korea became independent and waged an anti-Japanese armed struggle for 20 years to liberate the country from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 After the country's liberation, he founded a people's government of Juche type on the basis of the line of building a people's power he originally advanced during the armed struggle.
					
					 To that effect, he ensured that democratic elections were held for the first time in Korea's history to establish the People's Committee of North Korea.   He also convened the historic Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Public Organizations in North and South Korea and saw to it that the elections of deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly were held throughout Korea.
					
					 Meanwhile, he promulgated a series of laws on democratic reforms, such as the Agrarian Reform Law, the Nationalization of Major Industries Law, the Labour Law and the Law on Sex Equality.
					
					 His exploits performed for founding the DPRK, where the popular masses are masters of the state, will remain forever along with the history of socialist Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Danger of Japan's Alarming Military Spending
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Danger of Japan's Alarming Military Spending 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Japan was the fifth largest country in military spending for the fiscal 2012, according to a recent survey made by the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The ulterior aim sought by the Japanese reactionaries in frantically stepping up the arms buildup by spending a stupendous amount of funds is to arm the "Self-Defense Forces" with latest military hardware and hurl them into overseas aggression to realize their old dream to restore their empire at any cost.
					
					 The SDF is now being bolstered up to be aggression forces capable of mounting preemptive attacks. Accordingly, this alarming military spending is totally aimed at modernizing it and increasing its maneuverability and capability for conducting long-distance operations.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are pressing ahead with all these moves under the pretext of "coping with someone's threat". By "threatening force" the Japanese authorities mean the DPRK.
					
					 It is habitual practices of Japan to do evil things by finding fault with others. 
					
					 No matter how hard Japan may try to cover up its despicable true colors, it cannot escape strong criticism of the international community. 
					
					 Tokyo's policy of arms expansion is the root cause of threatening peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 It should stop working hard to emerge a military giant and launch overseas expansion. This is the only way out for it. 
					
					 Japan is the country which suffered a bitter defeat for frantically pursuing aggression and wars against other countries. It would be well advised not to forget the history of its disgraceful defeat.

articles.title: DPRK Is Country of Single-minded Unity: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Is Country of Single-minded Unity: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK have formed a big harmonious whole united close around the single central figure and based on monolithic idea, revolutionary conviction and obligation and they are opening up a bright future of prosperity. This is a true picture of the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 In the past 65 years the DPRK has realized the cause of modeling the whole society on the great Juche idea, Songun idea and has made victorious advance being strongly supported and deeply trusted by the broad range of masses by dint of the single-minded unity among the leader, party and the masses, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The army and people are hardening the pledge to share their destinies with the country and its social system, regarding the Juche idea, Songun idea as their faith, and are working heart and soul for the prosperity of the country. This is the revolutionary traits that pervade society of the DPRK.
					
					 The leader believes in the people and vice versa. This is a pronoun symbolic of the single-minded unity of the DPRK.
					
					 For the past 65 years since it was named after people, the DPRK has put forward the people as the most valuable beings, shaped all the line and policies for them and carried out creation and construction in reliance on the popular masses.
					
					 The people have cherished the faith that they can not live even a moment away from the embrace of the country. And it has become the habitual practices of the army and people to absolutely support and uphold all the line and policies set forth by the party and the state.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the Workers' Party of Korea and the people to further glorify the country as a socialist state shining with the might of the single-minded unity.

articles.title: Cancellation of Results of Screening of History Textbook Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Cancellation of Results of Screening of History Textbook Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore in an editorial on Wednesday demanding the cancellation of the results of the screening of the history textbook for higher schools, which embellishes pro-Japanese acts and dictatorship.
					 The editorial pointed to new controversial points being revealed one after another after the opening to public of the contents of the textbook compiled by neo-conservatives embellishing what was done by Syngman Rhee and Park Chung-Hee.
					
					 It held that the textbook has many more flaws in its content compared with other textbooks as it distorts history as evidenced by the justification of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule including the sexual slavery enforced by them, etc.
					
					 The Committee for Compiling National History is chiefly to blame for the flaws as it decided on finally approving the textbook at its screening.
					
					 It urged the committee to rectify its mistake by immediately canceling the results of screening of the textbook.

articles.title: Koreans in China Call for National Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in China Call for National Reunification
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, on Tuesday made public a statement "Let all Koreans pool efforts to drive U.S. imperialist aggression forces out of south Korea and achieve national reunification". 
					 68 years have passed since the U.S. imperialist aggression forces illegally occupied south Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces occupied half of Korea rejoiced over the liberation from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists. Since then they have mercilessly suppressed the patriotic struggle of south Korean people at the point of bayonets, pursuing a colonial enslavement policy.
					
					 They put politics, military, culture and all other fields of south Korea under their control, bringing immeasurable misfortunes and sufferings, tremendous human and material losses to the Koreans and seeking the permanent division of the Korean nation. 
					
					 Since the very outset of their occupation of south Korea they have frantically stepped up the arms buildup and intensified war drills against the DPRK, increasing the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 This goes to prove that the Koreans can neither achieve the independence and democracy of south Korean society and national reunification, the unanimous desire of the nation, nor ensure genuine peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula as long as the U.S. imperialist aggression forces are present in south Korea.
					
					 All the facts prove that the U.S. troops in south Korea are the arch criminals disturbing peace and stability on the peninsula and the vicious enemy who does not want to see Korea's reunification and the prosperity of the Korean nation. 
					
					 It is the Koreans who have the decisive strength to drive the U.S. troops out of south Korea. 
					
					 All of them should pool their efforts and turn out in a patriotic struggle to force the U.S. imperialist aggressor troops out of south Korea at an early date.

articles.title: Koreans in Uzbekistan Celebrate DPRK's 65th Birthday
articles.content:
Koreans in Uzbekistan Celebrate DPRK's 65th Birthday 
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan held an event on Sept. 1 in celebration of the 65th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 On display in the venue of the event were photos of President Kim Il Sung meeting overseas Koreans and photos of leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un inspecting units of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 There were also photos showing the true picture of the developing homeland. 
					
					 Ju Yong Il, chairman of "Elders" Society for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan, made a speech. 
					
					 He said that after the founding of the DPRK the Korean people became the master of an independent sovereign state and came to hew out their destiny independently and creatively.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the DPRK turned into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-sufficient in economy and self-reliant in defence and socialist fortress which no enemy dares provoke. 
					
					 The celebrations of the diamond jubilee of the war victory which demonstrated before the whole world the might of the DPRK and the ski resort on Masik Pass and many other sports and cultural facilities for the people now under construction eloquently prove the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The speaker called upon all other compatriots to more dynamically turn out in the drive for national reunification and prosperity, holding aloft the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					 A performance was given by Korean artistes there.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK Marked by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK Marked by Bulgarian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association published a bulletin on Aug. 29 to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "65th anniversary of DPRK" introduced in detail the nation-building exploits of President Kim Il Sung, noting he attached the greatest importance to the building of the people's government after the liberation of Korea on August 15, 1945 and led the struggle for it.
					
					 Noting Kim Il Sung declared the founding of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on September 9, 1948, the article said the founding was of great significance in the history of socialist Korea.
					
					 Also carried in the bulletin was the news about the events splendidly held in the DPRK to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Socialist system is the best" dealt with the foreign and domestic reporters' interview with Kim Kwang Ho and his wife and Ko Kyong Hui who returned the DPRK after being taken away to south Korea by the plot and deception of the puppet south Korean forces.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK to Be Celebrated in France
articles.content:
Anniversary of DPRK to Be Celebrated in France
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A French preparatory committee for celebrating the 65th anniversary of the DPRK was inaugurated in Paris on August 30.
					 Andre Aubry, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events including meeting, seminar and lecture in Paris and local areas on the occasion of the anniversary (September 9).

articles.title: Seminars to Mark Day of Songun, Birthday of DPRK Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars to Mark Day of Songun, Birthday of DPRK Held in Different Countries 
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Seminars took place in Pakistan, Nepal and France from August 25 to 31 on the occasion of the 53rd Day of Songun and the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Present there were personages of different circles and other people of relevant countries.
					
					 The general secretary of the Sind State Committee of the Pakistan Awami National Party, the chairman of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan and other speakers said that leader Kim Jong Il started his Songun leadership by visiting Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Thank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960, adding that this marked a historic event of great significance in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 They praised the Songun politics as a perfect political mode under socialism representing the 21st century.
					
					 A former vice-president of Senate and the chairman of the Study and Research Forum of Songun Politics of the National Press Club of Nepal praised President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for performing immortal exploits by leading the DPRK to victory and glory.
					
					 The chief of the French Group for the Study of Juche and Songun Idea noted that the revolutionary feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by turning the DPRK into an invincible power will always go down in history.
					
					 A congratulatory message to supreme leader Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Nepal.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Marked in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Marked in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups or aired special programs on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The Cambodian paper Kmae Amata on August 29 carried an article titled "65 years of victory and glory" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK has covered the road of victory and glory for 65 years, the article said, adding that all lines, policies and activities of the DPRK have been strictly geared to defend the independent rights and interests of the popular masses.
					
					 The Korean people have made great achievements in all domains of socialist construction in the spirit of "Speed on Masik Pass."
					
					 The Apsara Radio Broadcasting Service of Cambodia aired the similar program on August 27.
					
					 The September issue of the Pakistani magazine Peak Time dedicated eight pages to the articles such as "President Kim Il Sung is the founding-father of socialist Korea", "Independent power" and "Toward eminence of a thriving nation" illustrated with photos showing the undying exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The magazine also edited the photos introducing the true picture of Songun Korea and the happy life of the Korean people.
					
					 Mongolian television on August 22 repeatedly aired the Korean film dealing with the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 and the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Celebrated Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to mark the 65th anniversary of the DPRK from August 27 to 29.
					 They included an opening ceremony of the Korean book, photo and handcraft exhibition in Peru, a book and photo exhibition in Malaysia, meetings and film shows in Germany and Indonesia.
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Pyongyang Today" and "Korea Shining with Time-honored History." 
					
					 The mayor of Huancayo City in Junin Province of Peru said the exhibition offered its citizens an opportunity to know better about the DPRK, wishing the DPRK and its people bigger successes in their efforts to achieve the prosperity of the country under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The director of the air ticket booking center of the Malaysian Airways said:
					
					 The history of modern Korea is a history of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people united close around the great Generalissimos built a unique country strong in unity, independent and tremendous in its military power.
					
					 They are stepping up the building of a thriving nation, confident of their rosy future, as they are holding supreme leader Kim Jong Un in high esteem.
					
					 The chief of the Hanover Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany said the DPRK guided by the great Juche idea, Songun idea is an invincible socialist state. The progressives regard it as a beacon of hope, the chief added.
					
					 The director of the Indonesian Multi-commodity Company said:
					
					Indonesians greatly admire the Korean people who are advancing along the road of victory, foiling the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges to stifle the DPRK under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK is a politico-ideological and military power recognized by the world. I hope Korea would be reunified as early as possible.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Website of Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Website of Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The full texts of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's works "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us Who Are Advancing under the Unfurled Flag Bearing the Immortal Beaming Images of the Great Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il" and "Congratulatory Message to the Participants of Celebrations of Youth Day and Young People across the Country" were posted on the websites of the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on Aug. 24.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Talk Supported by Nigerian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Talk Supported by Nigerian
						
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, made public a statement on August 30 in support of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution".  The talk was carried in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the Korean People's Army, on August 25, the Day of Songun.
					 The chairman said that the talk is an important work indicating the road to be followed by the Korean people and the progressive mankind.
					
					 It is the firm conviction of all the Juche idea followers in Nigeria that the Korean people, rallied close around Marshal Kim Jong Un, would keep to the road of Songun, independence and socialism.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete en honor de judoka Sol Kyong
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete en honor de judoka Sol Kyong
						
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 6 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete en honor de la judoka Sol Kyong quien ocupo el primer lugar en el Campeonato Mundial de Judo de 2013.
					En la ocasion participaron el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Yong Il, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin y otros funcionarios junto con los jugadores y entrenadores.
					
					Kim Yong Jin, en su discurso de felicitacion, senalo que los deportistas coreanos logran uno  tras otro grandes exitos gracias al amor y la confianza del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien ofrece maxima gloria y felicidad a los deportistas quienes glorificaron el honor de la patria.
					
					Subrayo que todos los jugadores y entrenadores deben materializar los principios, metodos y sistema de tacticas a nuestro estilo en las competencias y lograr excelentes exitos en los partidos internacionales registrando el fervor de entrenamiento del monte Paektu.
					
					La judoka Sol Kyong, en su discurso de respuesta, dio agradecimiento al Mariscal quien le dispenso gran benevolencia y expreso la  firme decision de ganar de continuo en las competencias internacionales elevando la capacidad fisica y tecnica para responder al afecto del Mariscal.

articles.title: Embajador brasileno ofrece banquete por dia de independencia
articles.content:
Embajador brasileno ofrece banquete por dia de independencia
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El embajador de la Republica Federativa de Brasil en Corea, Roberto Colin, ofrecio hoy en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang una recepcion en ocasion del 191o aniversario de la independencia de su pais.
					Fueron invitados el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak Kun Gwang,  el viceministro de Comercio Exterior, O Ryong Chol, el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad RPDC-Brasil, So Ho Won, y otros funcionarios coreanos, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y los de organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en Corea.
					
					Estuvieron presentes los integrantes de la sede diplomatica brasilena.
					
					En su discurso, el embajador felicito calurosamente el 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC y dijo que su pais mantiene la posicion de desarrollar mas las relaciones de cooperacion entre ambos paises.
					
					Respaldo los esfuerzos del gobierno de la RPDC por solucionar por via pacifica el problema regional y manifesto la posicion de contribuir a la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Deseo al pueblo coreano notables exitos bajo la guia de Su Excelencia Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					A su vez, el canciller coreano expreso alegria de que el gobierno y el pueblo brasilenos lograran la estabilidad economica y el desarrollo del pais.
					
					Apunto que apoyan y cooperan mutuamente los pueblos de ambos paises que establecieron los lazos de amistad a base de la aspiracion comun a la independencia, la paz, el desarrollo y la prosperidad.
					
					Destaco que el gobierno de la RPDC seguira esforzandose por ampliar multilateralmente las relaciones bilaterales apreciando la amistad con Brasil.

articles.title: Tiene lugar funcion infantil por el 65o aniversario de la RPDC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar funcion infantil por el 65o aniversario de la RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 6 en el Anfiteatro del Parque Juventud la funcion conjunta de los miembros de grupos artisticos de ninos escolares de la ciudad de Pyongyang dedicada al 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					En el repertorio figuraban el sexteto "Mi pais es toda la vida del Generalisimo", el coro pequeno "Bandera de la Republica en flameo", el piano y la cancion "Nuestro pais hermoso", las canciones revolucionarias en serie y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes elogiaron las inmortales hazanas del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung quien fundo la RPDC, establecio el regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares y preparo la cuna de eterna felicidad del pueblo coreano.
					
					En la cancion acompanada de Oungum (instrumento nacional) "Anoramos e inolvidamos", el coro femenino "El General y los ninos" y otras, expresaron con emocion la gran anoranza al Generalisimo Kim Jong Il quien emprendio sin parar el largo camino del Songun por la patria, el pueblo y el futuro maravilloso de las generaciones venideras.
					
					Se presentaron igualmente los programas que muestran el aspecto alegre de los ninos escolares de todo el pais que bajo la atencion profunda del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, se forman como personal de la era del Songun con ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y fuerte constitucion fisica.

articles.title: Efectuadas semifinales de torneo de futbol
articles.content:
Efectuadas semifinales de torneo de futbol
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 6 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung las semifinales del torneo de futbol femenino de categoria A en celebracion del 65o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					En el partido 25 de Abril-Rimyongsu, equipos que ocuparon primer lugar en las llaves A y C, y en el encuentro Sobaeksu-Myohyangsan, lideres de las llaves B y D, resultaron ganadores 25 de Abril y Sobaeksu por 2:1, respectivamente.
